item.title: Roger Allers, co-director of The Lion King, dies aged 76
item.description: Roger Allers was known for working on various Disney films including The Lion King, The Little Mermaid and Aladdin.

item.title: Elphinstone Engineering director sentenced for interfering with Aboriginal relics
item.description: Graeme Elphinstone, the founder and director of Elphinstone Engineering, avoids conviction and is fined $12,000 for interfering with Aboriginal relics on his land on Tasmania's east coast.

item.title: Storm Hunter wins at Australian Open after thinking her career was over
item.description: A ruptured Achilles tendon threatened to send Storm Hunter into retirement, but her perseverance pays off with a first-round victory in Melbourne.

item.title: Petition asks Alice Springs Public Library to extend opening hours amid outback heat
item.description: In one of Australia's hottest towns, the library is an important air-conditioned public space offering a no-cost respite from burning summer temperatures.

item.title: Bondi survivor Ya'akov Tetleroyd lost his father and nearly his arm in Bondi Beach terrorism event. He forgives the gunmen
item.description: Ya'akov Tetleroyd's father died in the Bondi Beach shootings. He nearly lost his arm as a result of being shot, yet he told 7.30 in an exclusive interview that he forgives the gunmen.

item.title: WA is losing the tobacco wars as gangs target vape stores and cheap cigarettes flood market
item.description: Burnt out storefronts in Perth and regional cities are testament to the government's inability to control the illegal tobacco trade — and it's not clear when things will change, writes Keane Bourke.

item.title: What has caused a 'smack' of jellyfish to wash up on Melbourne's south-eastern beaches?
item.description: Visitors to Melbourne's south-eastern beaches over the weekend were surprised to see an influx of crimson jellyfish bobbing in the water. One expert says a "perfect storm" of factors has brought them to the coastline.

item.title: Nicolas Cage shrine amid weird pranks at Mount Gambier deputy mayor's home
item.description: A Nicolas Cage-themed shrine is the latest of a series of celebrity-themed pranks that Mount Gambier's deputy mayor says have befallen his home in recent weeks.

item.description: A member of the public tried to perform CPR on a teenage boy suffering serious injuries at the bottom of a cliff near Canberra, but he died at the scene.

item.title: Man faces court after 2kg of meth seized in Katherine roadside drug bust
item.description: A 22-year-old man has faced court after police allegedly found 2 kilograms of methamphetamine, along with large quantities of other drugs, during a traffic stop in Katherine last week.

item.description: In her first statement since she was shot through the hand on January 7, Tanya says she wants Kenneth Giles to know she wants him to return home.

item.description: Prince Harry has returned to court in London in his third and final attempt to tame the British tabloids through the legal system.

item.description: The fashion icon's creations were adored by Hollywood stars, royals and first ladies for his fail-safe red carpet designs.

item.title: EPA asks Victorians to check water quality before swimming in Port Phillip
item.description: Victoria's Environment Protection Authority says people wanting to cool off at bay beaches this summer should stay across its regular pollution updates.

item.title: Oak Tasmania issued $1.1m penalty over hundreds of NDIS compliance failures
item.description: Oak Tasmania admits to 474 compliance and reporting failures, as well as breaches that resulted in the hospitalisation of multiple NDIS clients.

item.title: How lifting gave me back the power to feel good at sport
item.description: As a child, Julie "wasn't one of the sporty kids". A safe gym environment and then a supportive powerlifting community helped her realise that wasn't actually true.

item.title: Labor 'really close' to deal with Liberals on hate speech laws, Tony Burke says
item.description: Liberal MPs gathered to discuss the draft laws at a party room meeting in Canberra on Monday evening after Opposition Leader Sussan Ley and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese met to hash out an agreement.

item.title: China ramps up crackdown on Christians amid global political pressures
item.description: Dozens of church leaders and members have been arrested in China in recent months, which advocates say is indicative of intensifying persecution.

item.title: China's population declines for a fourth straight year amid record low birthrates
item.description: National data shows that in 2025, China's population shrank by 3.39 million people, as experts warn the trend is likely to continue.

item.title: Donald Trump heading to Davos as bond market vigilantes plot against him
item.description: There are signs Donald Trump's bold strategy to artificially lower interest rates could backfire, as a level of disquiet emerges on money markets, particularly in bonds.

item.title: First Nations employee asked by supervisor about eating ants takes transport department to court
item.description: A First Nations employee at South Australia's Department for Infrastructure and Transport (DIT) has claimed she was sexually harassed by her supervisor and racially discriminated against when asked about eating ants before a cultural training session, court documents reveal.

item.title: New Trump tariffs on European allies could push EU to use 'trade bazooka'
item.description: Following the Trump administration's recent tariff threat on European allies, some experts warn it may push Europe closer to China, and potentially see the European Union use its anti-coercion instrument, also known as a "trade bazooka", in response.

item.title: Victorian bushfires squeeze beekeeper access to high-quality trees for bees ahead of winter
item.description: Apiarists in Victoria are wondering how they will keep their bees fed during winter after bushfires two years in a row render certain areas inaccessible.

item.title: Dissecting Donald Trump's Greenland message to Norway's PM, line by line
item.description: A text message from the US president to Norway's prime minister has fanned the flames of the geopolitical dumpster fire engulfing Greenland. We've analysed Donald Trump's claims to see if they stack up.

item.title: Women's captain departs football club after men's offensive Silly Saturday costumes
item.description: A women's senior football captain has stepped away from her local club after photos of the senior men's leadership team were posted online during their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations.

item.description: The dumping of the waste is the latest in a series of similar events for Ipswich, the city which some now call "Australia's waste capital".

item.description: A mayor's split-second decision to answer a phone call instead of heading into the surf may well have saved the life of his deputy.

item.description: Alexei Popyrin concedes he will look inwards once again to think about his career after a crushing loss sent him out of the Australian Open in the first round.

item.description: The $6.5 million Menindee fish passage trial is now in year two and results are "promising", but not everyone is buoyed by confidence in the project's ability to prevent another mass fish kill.

item.title: ASX trades down, BHP shares slide, IMF calls out Australia's 'drawn-out' inflation — as it happened
item.description: The ASX trades down on Tuesday. The International Monetary Fund says Australia, alongside Norway, is projected to see persistent above-target inflation. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: WA Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas seizes on fishing, tobacco to challenge government's dominance
item.description: While many West Australians were competing for parking spots at beaches on their holidays, Basil Zempilas latched onto two hot topics on which to challenge the government — the demersal fishing ban and WA's illicit tobacco trade.

item.title: Attempted murder charges laid, firearm recovered after Huntfield Heights shooting
item.description: A man and a woman are expected to face court after each was charged with two counts of attempted murder over a shooting at a Huntfield Heights home that left two people in hospital, police say.

item.title: Pilbara water sources drying up as blistering heatwave continues in Karratha
item.description: Water sources are depleting in the Pilbara as the arid region endures a summer with little rainfall and temperatures close to 50C.

item.description: Frustrated dual British-Australian citizens are weighing up their options in response to new passport rules. Here's why some are letting go of their British citizenship.

item.description: The Top End's pomelo industry is worried about the impending importation of the citrus fruit from Vietnam. They say it will depress the local market and bring a biosecurity risk.

item.title: Brisbane records higher fuel prices than any other capital city for third year running
item.description: Brisbane's fuel prices are more expensive than any other capital city for the third year in a row, with the RACQ revealing the cheapest suburbs to fill up.

item.title: Angus Crichton to leave Sydney Roosters and NRL to chase Wallabies World Cup dream
item.description: Star second-rower Angus Crichton will leave the Sydney Roosters at the end of the NRL season to pursue a career in rugby union.

item.title: What is skimo? All you need to know about the new Winter Olympics event ahead of Milano Cortina 2026 Games
item.description: Skimo is the newest sport at the Winter Olympics, but what is it? And who are the Aussies that will take on the challenge on the slopes of the infamous Stelvio climb?

item.title: Donald Trump's America-first policies are pushing countries into China's embrace
item.description: Inside China, there's a nickname for Donald Trump that tells you everything you need to know about how the US leader's actions are increasingly seen as a gift to Beijing.

item.title: Rockhampton residents urged to avoid floodwaters as Fitzroy River approaches peak
item.description: Police warn central Queensland residents against entering floodwaters, after several social media posts showed people in the shallows of a swollen river.

item.title: Crime gangs restocking shops 'up to 10 times a day' with illegal cigarettes and vapes, WA police say
item.description: WA's police commissioner says the restocking is happening faster than authorities can seize the products, as tobacco black market violence escalates.

item.title: American rider and brumby complete 4,400km journey across Australia
item.description: Gin Szagola and her brumby, Fable, have completed a coast-to-coast journey, covering 4,400 kilometres in eight months.

item.title: Alice Springs Mayor Asta Hill will not attend Australia Day ceremony
item.description: Asta Hill will not take part in celebrations of Australia Day, which she sees as a day causing harm to First Nations peoples — a decision described as "disgraceful" by the local member of the Northern Territory Legislative Assembly.

item.title: WA premier Roger Cook extends embattled Griffin Coal's lifeline, citing energy security concerns
item.description: Since 2022, the WA government has already tipped $300 million into propping up the insolvent Indian-owned miner, which is more than $1 billion in debt.

item.title: Canadian PM says smaller nations must 'band together' to stop larger countries overpowering them
item.description: Canadian PM Mark Carney told the World Economic Forum "middle powers must act together".

item.title: NZ Prime Minister Christopher Luxon calls for election on November 7
item.description: NZ's Prime Minister Christopher Luxon has announced the election date for 2026, promising economic prosperity if New Zealanders vote for him again.

item.title: Liberals 'not that stressed' by leak — but Labor seizes on attempt to 'destabilise' leader
item.description: The leaking of an SA Liberal document two months before the state election has been described by the Labor government as a "calculated and methodical" attempt to "destabilise" new leader Ashton Hurn — but her party says it is "not that stressed" because the policy is old.

item.title: What we know about changing UK passport requirements effective February 25
item.description: Hundreds of confused UK and Irish dual citizens in Australia have written to the ABC with questions around the new changes for entry requirements into the UK. Here's what we know.

item.title: Tobias Lund Andresen upsets sprint favourites in crazy Tanunda finish to take Tour Down Under lead
item.description: Tobias Lund Andresen out-sprinted favourites Sam Welsford and Matthew Brennan to claim a stunning victory into Tanunda and take the overall lead in the Tour Down Under.

item.title: Australian NATO envoy Di Turton warns North Korea has 'combat-ready troops in our region'
item.description: Australia's outgoing military envoy to NATO is preparing to return to Canberra after two years in the role, and she is coming home with a warning.

item.title: NSW Police slap bans on neo-Nazis entering Sydney CBD on Australia Day
item.description: Up to 12 neo-Nazis have been issued public safety orders banning them from entering central Sydney, shutting down plans to attend anti-immigration rallies on Australia Day.

item.title: Man who assassinated Shinzo Abe sentenced to life in prison by Japanese court
item.description: Tetsuya Yamagami pleaded guilty to fatally shooting Mr Abe as he stood surrounded by security, media and supporters in 2022.

item.title: Why Elina Svitolina is prioritising her mental health at the Australian Open
item.description: In the highly competitive world of professional tennis, it is refreshing to learn that Elina Svitolina has her priorities in order.

item.title: How Australia will mark the National Day of Mourning for Bondi victims
item.description: Today is a national day of mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terror attack. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: New South Wales man charged with allegedly threatening prime minister
item.description: A NSW Mid North Coast man is granted bail after he allegedly threatened to shoot the prime minister, in a video uploaded to social media.

item.title: Midnight Oil's Rob Hirst died of pancreatic cancer. It's one of Australia's deadliest
item.description: Rob Hirst was first diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in 2023. It is estimated to be the third most common cause of cancer death in Australia, and has among the lowest survival rates.

item.title: Have you been gifted an ancestry DNA test? The results could be 'life-altering'
item.description: If you're thinking of taking an ancestry DNA test as "a bit of fun", experts warn there is the risk of uncovering more than you bargained for.

item.title: Scathing report finds Kimberley prisoners sleeping on floor, in cockroach-infested cells
item.description: A damning report by Western Australia's prison watchdog dubs Broome Regional Prison "unfit for purpose".

item.title: Police believe Mandurah teacher's baby fathered by student she allegedly sexually abused
item.description: Police believe a Mandurah teacher gave birth to a baby fathered by a student she allegedly sexually assaulted.

item.title: Zeynep Sönmez thrills Turkish fans with latest Australian Open win
item.description: In front of her loyal supporters, Türkiye's Zeynep Sönmez advances to the Australian Open third round, as her remarkable run continues at Melbourne Park.

item.title: New hate laws have passed parliament. What do they actually do?
item.description: The new laws grant powers for the government to list so-called hate groups, more easily deport or cancel the visas of individuals associated with hate groups and create new aggravated penalties for leaders who advocate violence.

item.title: Donald Trump's second presidency is about 'might makes right' and reshaping the world order be it in Venezuela or Greenland
item.description: As Donald Trump celebrates one year of his second term in the White House, he is rewriting all the rules for global order, and no-one seems ready to stop his "imperial ambitions".

item.title: WA gold companies 'floating on a sea of cash' as the commodity hits new price record
item.description: A Kalgoorlie miner hopes the soaring price of gold will incentivise investment into regional WA.

item.title: Why Emmanuel Macron was wearing sunglasses at Davos World Economic Forum
item.description: The French president's appearance at the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum makes headlines, but not for any policy reasons.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Banned Adelaide doctor Bill Tolis in court over steroid importation charges
item.description: A man who was banned from working as a doctor in 2022 appears in court charged with importing steroids and peptides that the Australian Border Force allegedly found in a medical clinic and at his home.

item.title: Plane landing aborted after alleged trespassing incident near runway at Melbourne Airport
item.description: A pilot is forced to abort a landing attempt at Melbourne Airport, and two take-offs are delayed after an alleged late-night trespassing incident.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu, Azerbaijan agree to join Trump's 'Board of Peace' as Norway and Sweden reject invitations
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu agrees to join US President Donald Trump's "Board of Peace" despite his office previously criticising the makeup of the executive committee.

item.title: Father of Adelaide girl who died due to mother's alleged neglect tells court of coffin threat
item.description: The father of a 15-year-old girl whose mother is accused of her manslaughter, tells the South Australian Supreme Court of a threat made against his daughter and punishment she was made to do.

item.title: Coalition in chaos
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Coalition on the brink as Nationals quit shadow ministry
item.description: Opposition leader Sussan Ley says the Nationals' mass resignation from her frontbench is "unnecessary" and has urged the rural party to remain in the Coalition.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners raise dingo management issues after teen's death
item.description: The body of Piper James, 19, was found surrounded by dingoes on a beach on the island's eastern coast, but how she died may not be known for some time.

item.title: Real estate prices set records with six capitals now in 'million-dollar club' and Melbourne rebounding
item.description: The Melbourne real estate market is leading a "decisive recovery", according to property portal Domain, as the city hits a four-year high for its median house price after strong growth across the country last year.

item.title: Donald Trump drops Greenland tariffs threat as he heralds 'future deal' with NATO
item.description: Donald Trump says he has agreed to a "framework of a future deal" on Greenland after talks with NATO's secretary-general, and he will no longer impose tariffs on European nations that had opposed a US takeover.

item.title: Japan restarts nuclear power plant almost 15 years since Fukushima disaster
item.description: The world's biggest nuclear power plant has been rebooted by the same company that operated the Fukushima facility, despite concerns about safety from some locals.

item.title: Emotional Prince Harry says media made his wife Meghan Markle's life 'an absolute misery' at Daily Mail trial
item.description: An emotional Prince Harry held back tears as he described the impact of media coverage on his wife Meghan Markle.

item.title: Why Ukrainians are shivering through their fourth winter in wartime
item.description: The war-ravaged country has been plunged into an energy crisis as temperatures plummet below freezing, leaving millions unable to heat their homes.

item.title: Children and journalists killed by Israel in separate incidents in Gaza, Palestinian medics say
item.description: According to Palestinian medics, two boys aged 10 and 13 were among those killed on Wednesday in the latest violence which threatens to undermine a fragile ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Royal Hobart Hospital medical scan backlog creating late diagnosis risk, AMA says
item.description: The Royal Hobart Hospital is facing a significant backlog of medical scans, with at least one patient experiencing a late diagnosis. The AMA and a union say it's a sign of a system facing a range of pressures.

item.title: Students have their say in disaster planning in Melbourne's bushfire-prone outer east
item.description: In a bushfire-prone area in outer Melbourne, a group of students is taking part in a two-way learning exchange to improve bushfire safety.

item.title: How closely have you been following the 2026 awards season?
item.description: Fancy yourself an awards season whiz? Test your knowledge as we rocket towards the 2026 Academy awards.

item.title: Republicans push to hold Clintons in contempt of Congress over Epstein probe
item.description: The Clintons are refusing to testify before a committee in the US House of Representatives, accusing Republicans of leading a weaponised process against them.

item.title: Sydney rabbi shares rituals behind how Jews grieve and heal, amid National Day of Mourning for Bondi victims
item.description: Amid the National Day of Mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, Rabbi Jacqueline Ninio shares what mourning looks like in Jewish culture, from the resonance of stones at gravesites to the 30-day period of grieving.

item.title: Bondi lifeguard pictured running barefoot in viral photo recalls night of terror attack
item.description: Much of Jackson 'Jacko' Doolan's memory from December 14 is a blur, but there is one moment that remains crystal clear.

item.title: Calls to bring back hard-hitting anti-smoking campaigns to warn off gen Z
item.description: Experts say Australia risks becoming complacent in the war against tobacco, with big companies pivoting to social media to "greenwash" their products to generation Z.

item.title: Some Adelaide University students unable to enrol in courses since merger
item.description: The Adelaide University merger has been labelled a "shambles" by some students who say they have been unable to enrol in courses or receive timely communication from the new university.

item.title: Nationals walkout leaves Coalition on life support, again
item.description: The departure of every single member of the Nationals from the frontbench is bizarrely both a failure of the Coalition agreement and a result of it functioning as intended.

item.title: Australia earns global praise for economic 'soft landing' but still dependent on China
item.description: A new report from the OECD says Australia's economy is returning to normal but remains vulnerable and lacks dynamism.

item.title: Europe holds the trump card as the US faces a mountain of debt
item.description: For decades, global investors have bought US government debt as a safe haven when things turn pear-shaped. But investor attitudes are changing, and America's financial domination is at stake.

item.title: The shark mitigation measures in place at NSW beaches
item.description: Shark mitigation measures have come a long way since the first nets were rolled out in Sydney almost 90 years ago.

item.title: Batteries will form a larger part of the state's electricity grid going forwards
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Grayson Cavanagh has candles on hand for blackouts, which are expected to become increasingly common
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Microgrid trials underway as Queensland electricity grid looks to boost network resiliency amid blackouts
item.description: Tens of thousands of homes across Queensland have lost power during storms this season – an uncomfortable, expensive experience, which could become more common.

item.title: 'Ten-pound Pom' vows to boycott UK over 'money grab' passport changes
item.description: People who came to Australia as children from the UK as part of an organised migration scheme say they the UK's new regulations for dual citizens unfairly targets them.

item.title: Hobart Hurricanes beat Melbourne Stars in rainy thriller to keep BBL title defence alive
item.description: The Hobart Hurricanes hold their nerve to beat the Melbourne Stars in a rain-shortened Big Bash elimination final.

item.title: Sinner weighs up Kyrgios and Kim Jong-Un, plus an Aussie exodus — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Jannik Sinner was stuck in an awkward moment discussing Nick Kyrgios and Kim Jong-Un while Coco Gauff shared her top artists. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Taskforce set up to address ongoing power outages across SA from dust pollution
item.description: Ongoing dry conditions across South Australia since 2024 are causing dust and salt to build up across inland and coastal power networks, polluting insulators and leading to mass blackouts.

item.title: ASX to open higher, as Wall Street absorbs Trump's latest tariff remarks, live updates
item.description: The ASX is set to open higher as Donald Trump withdraws his threat to impose new tariffs. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Police Association says Coober Pedy and APY Lands are 'unacceptably compromised' by police shortage
item.description: South Australia's police union says some officers in the remote town are working 18-hour days and have been unable to respond to all incidents, amid an ongoing industrial dispute with SA Police.

item.title: Federal politics live: Nationals won't rule out Coalition split after quitting shadow ministry en masse
item.description: After quitting the shadow ministry en masse in solidarity with three colleagues dumped for crossing the floor on hate laws, the Nationals won't rule out breaking away from the Coalition again Follow live.
